questions.text: You find a wallet on the street, containing $100 cash and an ID.

options.text: Take the cash, ditch the wallet.
Try to return the wallet and cash to the owner.
Leave it where it is. Not your problem.
Take it to the police station.

questions.text: You're at a restaurant and the waiter brings you the wrong order. You:

options.text: Eat it anyway to avoid confrontation.
Demand to speak to the manager immediately.
Politely point out the mistake and ask for the correct order.
Use this as an opportunity to get a free meal.

questions.text: Your coworker takes credit for your idea in a meeting. You:

options.text: Immediately call them out in front of everyone.
Wait for a private moment to discuss it with them.
Document everything and plan your revenge carefully.
Let it go, but never trust them again.

questions.text: You're running late for an important appointment. You:

options.text: Speed and run red lights to make up time.
Call ahead to explain and ask to reschedule.
Blame traffic and prepare an elaborate excuse.
Take your time and arrive whenever.

questions.text: You discover your friend has been lying to you. You:

options.text: Confront them immediately with evidence.
Pretend you don't know and gather more information.
Give them a chance to come clean on their own.
Cut them off completely without explanation.

questions.text: You're in a group project and someone isn't pulling their weight. You:

options.text: Do their work to avoid conflict.
Call them out publicly in the next meeting.
Document their lack of contribution for later use.
Work around them and let them fail on their own.

questions.text: You receive an email from a stranger asking for sensitive information. You:

options.text: Reply immediately with the requested information.
Forward it to IT and mark it as spam.
Use it as an opportunity to gather information about them.
Assume it's a scam and delete it without reading.

questions.text: You're offered a promotion that requires moving to a new city. You:

options.text: Accept immediately without considering the consequences.
Negotiate for better terms before accepting.
Take time to carefully weigh the pros and cons.
Decline, fearing the unknown risks.
